page.title: 02GREAT OFFLEY.
page.content: Offley is a village of moderate size situated half-way between Hitchin and Luton, at the edge of the A505 on top of a hill, with a panoramic view of the countryside. This quiet country village affords much to its residents and frequent visitors. Its countryside is criss-crossed by bridlepaths and footpaths, along which there is a wide variety of flora and fauna. The chalk hill has many wild flowers particular to that soil. There are many clubs and societies in Offley, of which a number are affili- ated to the Recreation Centre; e.g. football, cricket and tennis clubs; the fishing club also meets there. The Centre has over 600 members. There is also a very active Riding Club and many horses are at livery in Offley.
